page.title: 10CHEDDON FITZPAINE VILLAGE
page.content: Cheddon Fitzpaine village is the old part on the east side of the church.A new village with modern housing and a school lies to the west. The old village has no shops except for the post office.There is a black- smith who shoes the local horses.There are 5/6 farms surrounding the village. Glebe,the largest,is a dairy farm. The old dairy,where the milk would at one time go,is now a private house.Now the milk goes by tanker to Wellington. An inscription on one farm building dates it to 1705. Cheddon has a Women's Institute.The President has been a member for 12 years.The W.I. do all kinds of things such as outings,talks,skittles,classes and demonstrations.They meet the first Thursday of the month at 7.30 pm. The president of the W.I. thinks life in Cheddon is "lovely".
